designScenario.name: Hydraulic Pump
designScenario.description: The Hydraulic Pump serves as the primary energy conversion unit in an aircraft's hydraulic system, efficiently converting mechanical energy into hydraulic pressure with enhanced energy efficiency and thermal management. It powers control surfaces, landing gears, and braking systems while operating under extreme conditions. The design incorporates dual-stage pump technology, real-time pressure and temperature monitoring, and full integration with aircraft avionics for enhanced diagnostics and redundancy.

details.description: The pump shall achieve an energy conversion efficiency of at least 90% under nominal operating conditions to minimize energy losses.
The pump must maintain an operating pressure between 1800 psi and 4800 psi with deviations not exceeding ±10% during steady-state operations.
The system shall achieve target hydraulic pressure within 0.4 seconds to support high-speed actuation demands during critical flight phases.
The pump must include dual fail-safe mechanisms to reroute hydraulic fluid to a standby reservoir and isolate faulty sections in case of malfunction.
The pump shall incorporate a thermal management system to maintain operational temperatures between -40°C and 120°C, with a maintenance cycle of 500 flight hours.

systemComponents.name: Hydraulic Pump
systemComponents.description: Primary energy conversion unit utilizing dual-stage pump technology to convert mechanical energy into hydraulic pressure, supporting aircraft control systems with enhanced efficiency and redundancy.

subComponents.name: Drive Motor
subComponents.description: Electric motor providing variable-speed mechanical input to the pump assembly for optimized energy efficiency.

subComponents.name: Pump Assembly
subComponents.description: Mechanical assembly with two-stage pressurization to ensure consistent hydraulic output under varying load conditions.

subComponents.name: Temperature Control Module
subComponents.description: Integrated thermal management system monitoring and regulating operational temperatures to prevent overheating.

subComponents.name: Pressure Sensor
subComponents.description: Real-time pressure monitoring unit ensuring accurate pressure regulation and fault detection.

systemComponents.name: Fluid Reservoir
systemComponents.description: Stores and supplies aerospace-grade hydraulic fluid, maintaining cleanliness and adequate fluid levels for the pump's operation.

subComponents.name: Reservoir Tank
subComponents.description: Primary storage container for hydraulic fluid with integrated filtration and pressure regulation.

subComponents.name: Filtration Unit
subComponents.description: Removes contaminants from hydraulic fluid to ensure system reliability and component longevity.

subComponents.name: Pressure Regulator
subComponents.description: Regulates fluid pressure entering the Hydraulic Pump to maintain optimal operational parameters.

systemComponents.name: Hydraulic Valve
systemComponents.description: Manages fluid flow direction and pressure distribution to various aircraft systems based on real-time operational demands.

relationships.description: The Hydraulic Pump relies on the Fluid Reservoir to supply clean, pressurized hydraulic fluid for operation.
The Drive Motor is an integral subcomponent of the Hydraulic Pump, providing mechanical power input.
The Pump Assembly is a critical subcomponent responsible for converting mechanical energy into hydraulic pressure.
The Temperature Control Module is integrated into the Hydraulic Pump to ensure thermal stability.
The Pressure Sensor is embedded within the Hydraulic Pump to monitor output pressure in real time.
The Pressure Regulator is a subcomponent of the Fluid Reservoir, controlling fluid pressure before delivery to the pump.
The Hydraulic Pump interfaces with the Hydraulic Valve to direct fluid flow to specific aircraft systems under dynamic conditions.

attributes.name: operatingPressure
attributes.description: Operating pressure range ensuring optimal performance and system reliability.

attributes.name: flowRate
attributes.description: Maximum flow rate adjustable to meet varying hydraulic demand levels.

attributes.name: fluidType
attributes.description: Aerospace-grade hydraulic fluid compliant with military specifications for extreme temperature and pressure resistance.

attributes.name: integrationLevel
attributes.description: Complete integration with aircraft avionics for real-time monitoring and control.

attributes.name: maintenanceCycle
attributes.description: Scheduled maintenance interval for component inspection and fluid replenishment.

attributes.name: operatingTemperature
attributes.description: Temperature range within which the pump operates effectively.

attributes.name: noiseLevel
attributes.description: Maximum permissible noise output to meet aircraft cabin noise standards.

comments.body: Primary hydraulic pump system for aircraft flight controls
